item.title: Outside no.27, 18th June
item.description:
Workers came and dug this hole yesterday morning, leaving a wire exposed and so surrounding the hole with a fence which is now partially blocking an already narrow part of the pavement. There are no signs indicating who did this, not has there been any activity since.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Georgiana Street, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hollyoak Wood Park - missed again, 18th June
item.description:
Willersley Park and Marlborough Park are cut more frequently than Hollyoak Wood Park. A four foot strip is cut around the outside of the park on occasion but not the entire park. Why is not the the entire park cut as regularly as the others?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oaklands Avenue, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrowth of trees hedges and greenery, 18th June
item.description:
The pathway extending from Cockmannings to Chestfield Road is currently impassable to walk on due to significant overgrowth. Lack of maintenance, possibly dating back to the previous year or even earlier, has rendered the path extremely hazardous, particularly for pedestrians with young children or those using strollers. The narrow width forces users to the edge, creating a dangerous proximity to vehicular traffic. Similarly, the walkway from Cockmannings to Chelsfield Lane presents similar challenges; the overgrown vegetation and narrow width make passage difficult, even for unaccompanied children, and nearly impossible for those using strollers.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cockmannings Road, St Mary Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
